description: Maintain the dimension of the input grid in the output grid.
Copy over the leftmost diagonal from the input grid into the output grid without changing anything about the color, position or dimension of the object.

Building on Step 2, draw a new diagonal line in the same color as the leftmost diagonal, starting the diagonal two columns right or left of that diagonal. This ensures that the transformation maintains the grid's dimensions while accommodating the three colors present in the input.
Continue drawing these diagonals until there is no more grid space to cover, maintaining the color of the first object.
Copy over the second, middle diagonal in the input to the output grid.

Because there are three colors to account for in the input, draw the next diagonal right or left two columns away, in the same color as the second diagonal copied over from the input in the last step.
Continue drawing diagonals until there is no more grid space to draw. These diagonals should be directly next to the first diagonals you drew.
Now copy over the third, rightmost diagonal from the input.

Because there are three colors to account for in the input, draw the next diagonal left or right starting two columns away, in the same color as the second diagonal copied over from the input in the last step.
Continue drawing diagonals until there is no more grid space to draw. These diagonals should be directly next to the second diagonals you drew.
